column19: Scotty beams Spock and Bones onto the Franklin separately so they didn't get spliced. Like Tuvix. #STB^2016-12-31 21:33:17 +0000
column20: "Among the legends re: the fate of the Franklin: A giant green hand a reference to TOS' "Who Mourns for Adonias?" #STB"^2016-12-31 21:27:46 +0000
column21: "It's Martine and Tomlinson that are killed by Krall. Those names of the couple who married in TOS' "Balance of Terror." #STB"^2016-12-31 21:22:27 +0000
column23: The Franklin is named after Justin Lin's father. The registry number is a reference to Leonard Nimoy's birthday (NX-326/March 26th). #STB^2016-12-31 21:17:06 +0000
column24: "Jaylah was inspired by Jennifer Lawrence's performance in "Winter's Bone." Her nickname of J. Law eventually became Jaylah. #STB"^2016-12-31 21:16:41 +0000
column25: The set the crew is held in is actually Pit River Quarries in BC. Production design completely rearranged it and painted it blue. #STB^2016-12-31 21:10:18 +0000
column26: Some of the exteriors when the crew is first split up on the planet Altamid was done at the Squamish Boulders in Canada. #STB^2016-12-31 21:06:48 +0000
column27: "Most of the filming for #STB was done in Vancouver BC Canada instead of Southern California like the first two films."^2016-12-31 21:05:11 +0000
